results.title: Adieu Voyages Lents
results.brief_description:
This multi-parts film deals with the difficulties of sustaining a relationship under the pressure of modern life. In ‘Nuit, une guerre’, a couple’s amourous pursuits are interrupted by the noises coming from the street and the neighbouring appartments. In ‘Entrevu par l’indiscretion d’un Judas’, a man hears is own story told on the radio by a ‘talk-back’ programme listener and realises his wife has left him to seek refuge with her mother in the country. In ‘Adieu voyages lents’, Simone reveals to her mother the reason for leaving her husband and aborting the child she was expecting.

Credits: Director, writer, Marie-Genevieve Ripeau ; photography, Jean-Francis Gondre.
Cast: Andree Tainsy, Michele Simonnet, Evelyne Dandry, Jean-Francois Stevenin, Virgineie Thevenet.

results.title: Adieu Philippine
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rozier, Georges de Beauregard and Alain Raygot
results.brief_description:
In his last few months before military service, a young TV technician, on holiday, is torn bewteen two girls. Rozier’s first feature, using improvisation, amateur performers, hidden microphones and cameras in real locations, had a rough spontaneity very much in line with the aesthetics of the ‘nouvelle vague’. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producers, Alain Raygot, Jean-Pierre Vic ; director, Jaqcues Rozier ; writers, Jacques Rozier, Michele O’Glor ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Maxime Saury, Paul Mattei, Jacques Danjean.
Cast: Jean-Claude Aimini, Yveline Cery, Arlette Gilbert, Jeanne Perez, Chouquette Deschamps, Maurice Garrel, Vittorio Caprioli.

results.title: Adieu L'ami = So Long, Friend
results.brief_description:
A friendship develops between a French doctor and an American mercenary when both are discharged from the army. Dino and Propp combine forces to help a woman return some stolen bonds before the crime can be discovered. They become trapped for three days in the underground vault system. Propp helps Dino escape before he is captured by the police. The two fall victim to the woman who was used as bait to get them to open the safe. Note: In this version, Charles Bronson’s voice is dubbed in French by American filmmaker John Berry.

Credits: Producer, Serge Silberman ; director, Jean Herman ; writer, Sebastien Japrisot ; photography ; Jean-Jacques Tarbes ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Alain Delon, Charles Bronson, Olga Georges-Picot, Bernard Fresson, Brigitte Fossey.

results.title: Adieu Bonaparte = Al-Wedaa Ya Bonaparte
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine, Humbert Balsan, Marianne Khoury and Jean-Pierre Mahot
results.brief_description:
The experiences of an Egyptian family during the occupation of Alexandria by Napoleon and his army, and the uneasy friendship between a young Egyptian poet and one of Bonaparte’s advisers.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Pierre Mahot, Marianne Khoury, Humbert Balsan ; director, Youssef Chahine ; writers, Youssef Chahine, Jean-Michel Comet, Mohsen Mohiedine, Youry Nasrallah ; photography, Moshen Nasr ; music, Gabriel Yared.
Cast: Michel Piccoli, Patrice Chereau, Moshen Mohiedine, Moshena Tewfik.

results.title: ADHA: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It examines ADHD in the under 5’s, school age children, and adults, as well as covering diagnosis, behaviour techniques, alternative treatment and medication.

results.title: Adenauer: Germany reborn
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: A presentation of the career of Adenauer, West Germany’s Chancellor from 1945-1963. Provides footage of the concentration camps, the Nuremburg trial, the Allied occupation of Germany, the Berlin airlift of 1948, the establishment of a new government in Bonn in 1949 and the building of the Berlin wall. Pro American narration by Henry Fonda.

results.title: Adelheid [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Frantisek Vlacil and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: A work of the Czech New Wave film movement which emerged during the 1960s only to be brutally repressed after the Soviet invasion of Czechoslovakia in 1968, “Adelheid” is a gripping love story confronting the human dimensions of love and loyalty, and of individuals trapped in the march of history. Viktor has returned to Czechoslovakia after serving as an opposition soldier in Britain during World War II. He has been assigned to manage a confiscated German mansion in northern Moravia, along the Czech and German border, a location that allows the film to ruminate on recent history and ethnic strife. He soon falls in love with Adelheid, daughter of the former owner of the house who has been reduced to servant status. Despite the fact that she can’t speak a word of Czech and he can’t speak German, the pair develop a mute, uneasy romantic and sexual understanding. Beyond Viktor’s enamored power play and Adelheid’s inscrutable complacence, their affair is fleshed out by their mutual loneliness and shared loss. Cast includes Petr Cepek, Emma Cerna, Jan Vostrcil and Pavel Landovsky. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: Adelaide: flowers and festival
results.creator_credit: J.A. Correll, G Shepherd and South Australian Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Scenes in Adelaide showing events in the biennial Festival of Arts 1968. The accent is on Flower Day and its associated pageantry and processions. Snippets of the Festival of Arts demonstrate Adelaide’s attractiveness as a festival venue during vintage time when the weather is still sunny. Narrated by Peter Wells.

results.title: Adelaide waters
results.brief_description: Discussion of the problem of using the waters of the Murray River as the major source of Adelaide’s domestic water supply. Looks at the political history of the Dartmouth Dam, and the probability of severe water shortages in the case of prolonged drought. An excellent discussion starter for studies relating to water management.
